Market Analysis 1LegendMets Testing Alicoco polycarbonate short wear life in areas Vietnamese spirals ? OreKinetics PU lined fibre glass CT1 TPU segments Plastic accessories Wear testing build new device repeat historical tests Mets trials chrome Canadian iron ore Site trials chrome Canadian iron ore P1, P3 on selected commodity - to doP1 = CT1 / MG6.3 profilePrototypingP1 & P2 at high density - in progressP1 & P2 more typical feed - to doP1 vs P3 - to doDoneIn progressTo doEmpirical wear testsP1 proof of concept - doneP1 vs P2 - doneP2 = ~ HG10 profileP4 = ??P3 = P1 @ 400mm diameterGo To Market Strategy Small to mid-cap miner, resource constrained Limited technical expertise in-house Risk-averse but budget-limited Pain points: Fear of wrong specification, limited vendor management capacity Decision criteria: Brand reputation (30%), price (30%), turnkey solution (25%), warranty (15%) Persona 4 Junior Mining Company Procurement Manager#Buying Process Typical Journey
#Buying Process Decision Influencers & Their Priorities
#Buying Process Inputs NeededBuying Process
#Primary Buyer Personas
#Buying Process
#Customer Tiers2. Customer Segmentation (FAST GTM)
##Persona 1 Cost-Constrained Operations Manager
##Persona 2 Brownfield Expansion Project Manager
##Persona 3 BOOM Operator
##Persona 4 Junior Mining Company Procurement Manager
##Inputs Needed (Personas)Primary Buyer Personas Re-uses flow sheet for multiple clients Needs flexible, multi-commodity capability ROI-focused, 2-3 year payback requirement Pain points: Equipment downtime = revenue loss, inflexible equipment Decision criteria: Price (35%), reliability/uptime (30%), versatility (20%), support response time (15%) Persona 3 BOOM Operator Mid-tier miner Evaluated on cost per ton, uptime Limited capital budget, needs board approval for > $100k Pain points: budget, pressure to reduce opex, limited engineering staff Decision criteria: Price (40%), lead time (25%), proven reliability (20%), support (15%) Persona 1 Cost-Constrained Operations Manager Adding capacity to existing plant Tight timeline and fixed budget Doesn't want to over-engineer Pain points: Equipment lead times delaying commissioning, budget overruns Decision criteria: Delivery time (35%), price (30%), compatibility with existing equipment (20%), technical risk (15%) Persona 2 Brownfield Expansion Project Manager Process Engineer (Technical gate): Performance specifications, operating parameters Operations Manager (User gate): Reliability, maintenance requirements, support Procurement Manager (Commercial gate): Price, terms, delivery, risk management Plant Manager (Budget holder): Total cost of ownership, business case CFO/Board (Final approval >$X): Financial return, strategic fit Buying Process Decision Influencers & Their Priorities Awareness (Problem recognition) - 0-2 months Equipment failure, capacity expansion need, new project Consideration (Vendor shortlist) - 1-3 months RFQ process, 2-3 vendors typically Evaluation (Technical & commercial) - 2-4 months Technical specification review, site visits, reference checks Decision (Approvals & contracting) - 1-3 months Multiple approval levels depending on value Implementation (Delivery & commissioning) - 3-6 months Buying Process Typical Journey Sales Team: Average sales cycle length by deal size and region Sales Team: Approval thresholds by customer type Sales Team: Typical RFQ requirements and evaluation criteria Finance: Payment terms and financing options currently offered Buying Process Inputs Needed Strategy: Generally NOT the target for FAST spirals initially Exception: Brownfield, non-critical applications where they specify "budget option acceptable" Risk: Brand dilution if they associate your company with "cheap equipment" PRIMARY TARGET Multiple sites, professional procurement, cost-conscious Want brand reliability but don't need cutting-edge performance PRIMARY TARGET Price-sensitive, limited technical resources Need support but can't afford premium pricing SECONDARY TARGET (Phase 2) Highly price-sensitive, often purchasing through distributors May need financing or rental options Customer Tiers Sales: Customer interviews (10-15) to validate personas Sales: CRM data analysis - buyer titles, company sizes, deal characteristics Sales: Survey of lost opportunities - why didn't they buy? Sales: Common support requests by customer type Inputs Needed (Personas) Mineral Sands: mitigate the risk of losing market share to low cost suppliers with this new product line. Iron ore: North America, Western Australia Chromite: Emerging market segment with less brand loyalty Industrial minerals: silica sand, garnet Iron ore, because there is not an urgent need to protect market share Challenge this approach - Brazilians setting up shop in Quebec to refurbish spirals. Chromite, because the market is small Coal, because this market is not growing and the spirals are large diameter. Target Industries & Applications Sales Historical data on lost opportunities due to price (last 3 years) Sales Estimate of deals lost to low-cost Asian manufacturers Sales Total addressable market for spirals by commodity (units/year, AUD), focus on [Target Commodity] Sales Current average spiral sale price by commodity segment Size the "budget buyer" segment (estimate 30-40% of total market) Growth projections for [Target Commodity] Market Size & Growth Africa India Southeast Asia South America Australia North America Challenge - does this need region need to be in phase 1 to combat spiral refurbishment in Canada? Europe Sales: Price sensitivity analysis by geography Sales: Local competitor presence and pricing Operations: Import duties, local content requirements by country Operations: Logistics costs and lead times to each region Geographic Priorities Low-cost Asian manufacturers (Chinese, Vietnamese suppliers) Second-hand/refurbished spirals mtSpirals (internal cannibalization risk) Alternative separation methods (tables, jigs, centrifugal concentrators) Sales: Competitor pricing database (models, capacities, prices) Sales: Win/loss analysis - why customers choose competitors Engineering: Technical performance comparison (recovery, grade, capacity) Engineering: Feature comparison matrix Sales: Competitor after-sales service reputation Established brand reputation (risk mitigation for buyers) Global service network Technical support and process optimization expertise Faster delivery than Asian imports (potentially) Quality consistency vs. local fabricators Competitive LandscapeXT (e.g. larger diameter CT)Segment toolingSegment toolingFixture toolingFeed box toolingSlide splitterProduct box tooling

info_showCustomIcons.description: Show custom icons for files and folders

info_showDefaultFolderIcons.description: Show a default icon of a folder for every folder in the tree

info_showDefaultFileIcons.description: Show a default icon of a file for every file in the tree

info_defaultFolderIcon.description: The icon to use for folders. Prefix with 'lucide//' to use a Lucide icon

info_defaultFileIcon.description: The icon to use for files. Prefix with 'lucide//' to use a Lucide icon

info_defaultMediaIcon.description: The icon to use for media files. Prefix with 'lucide//' to use a Lucide icon

info_exposeStartingPath.description: Whether or not to show the current file in the file tree when the page is first loaded

info_showOrphanNodes.description: Show nodes that are not connected to any other nodes.

info_showAttachments.description: Show attachments like images and PDFs as nodes in the graph.

info_allowGlobalGraph.description: Allow the user to view the global graph of all nodes.

info_allowExpand.description: Allow the user to pop-out the graph view to take up the whole screen

info_attractionForce.description: How much should linked nodes attract each other? This will make the graph appear more clustered.

info_linkLength.description: How long should the links between nodes be? The shorter the links the more connected nodes will cluster together.

info_repulsionForce.description: How much should nodes repel each other? This will make disconnected parts more spread out.

info_centralForce.description: How much should nodes be attracted to the center? This will make the graph appear more dense and circular.

info_edgePruning.description: Edges with a length above this threshold will not be rendered, however they will still contribute to the simulation. This can help large tangled graphs look more organised. Hovering over a node will still display these links.

info_minNodeRadius.description: How small should the smallest nodes be? The smaller a node is the less it will attract other nodes.

info_maxNodeRadius.description: How large should the largest nodes be? Nodes are sized by how many links they have. The larger a node is the more it will attract other nodes. This can be used to create a good grouping around the most important nodes.

info_allowResizing.description: Whether or not to allow the sidebars to be resized

info_allowCollapsing.description: Whether or not to allow the sidebars to be collapsed

info_rightDefaultWidth.description: The default width of the right sidebar

info_leftDefaultWidth.description: The default width of the left sidebar

info_selector.description: CSS selector for an element. The feature will be placed relative to this element.

info_type.description: Will this feature be placed before, after, or inside (at the beggining or end).

info_featurePlacement.description: Where to place this feature on the page. (Relative to the selector)

info_sourcePath.description: The local path to the source .html file which will be included.

info_allowFoldingLists.description: Whether or not to allow lists to be folded

info_allowFoldingHeadings.description: Whether or not to allow headings to be folded

info_siteUrl.description: The url that this site will be hosted at

info_authorName.description: The name of the author of the site
